channel.title: ASF Jira
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [THRIFT-4370] Ubuntu Artful cppcheck and flake8 are more stringent and causing SCA build job failures
item.summary: Ubuntu Artful cppcheck and flake8 are more stringent and causing SCA build job failures

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.

comments.comment: thrift.thriftl.cc (flex generated) yy_init_buffer now has 3 warnings of a possible null pointer dereference. I omitted the file from the scan for now.

Running flake8 on test/py yields a lot of new issues:

root@678d13d5f3b9:/thrift/src# flake8 --ignore=E501 test/py | cut -d' ' -f2 | sort | uniq
E303
E305
E722
F401
F403
F405
F811
W391

Details (just for the Recursive.thrift generated files):

test/py/gen-py-default/Recursive/ttypes.py:9:1: F401 'thrift.Thrift.TMessageType' imported but unused
test/py/gen-py-default/Recursive/ttypes.py:9:1: F401 'thrift.Thrift.TException' imported but unused

test/py/gen-py-default/Recursive/TestService.py:597:1: W391 blank line at end of file

As such I am going to disable flake8 on test/py and open a backlog item in Jira to re-enable it.

Interesting - the build job that runs in CI doesn't generate any code before running flake8. In my environment I have built everything and then I am running flake8. So an issue here is that the build job is insufficient. It needs to run "make precross" before doing static analysis which I will add.

GitHub user jeking3 opened a pull request:

https://github.com/apache/thrift/pull/1399

THRIFT-4370: build generated code before running static code analysis…

… - fix E722 flake8 issues identified in python code

You can merge this pull request into a Git repository by running:

$ git pull https://github.com/jeking3/thrift THRIFT-4370

Alternatively you can review and apply these changes as the patch at:

https://github.com/apache/thrift/pull/1399.patch

To close this pull request, make a commit to your master/trunk branch
with (at least) the following in the commit message:

This closes #1399

commit 85d94cce732f289d596b98c76042f1caae17d269
Author: James E. King, III <jking@apache.org>
Date: 2017-10-25T13:57:18Z

THRIFT-4370: build generated code before running static code analysis - fix E722 flake8 issues identified in python code

Github user RobberPhex commented on a diff in the pull request:

https://github.com/apache/thrift/pull/1399#discussion_r147048687

— Diff: lib/py/setup.py —
@@ -22,7 +22,7 @@
import sys
try:
from setuptools import setup, Extension
-except:
+except Exception:
— End diff –

I think we should use distutils.core, and setuptools is feedback,
And we should only process ImportError.
```py
try:
from distutils.core import setup, Extension
except ImportError:
from setuptools import setup, Extension
```

Github user jeking3 commented on a diff in the pull request:

https://github.com/apache/thrift/pull/1399#discussion_r147157619

— Diff: lib/py/setup.py —
@@ -22,7 +22,7 @@
import sys
try:
from setuptools import setup, Extension
-except:
+except Exception:
— End diff –

I have to resubmit anyway to kick off another PR build, but I'd like to leave it as I changed it for now, and it can be improved later through a subsequent PR. I was just trying to eliminate those pesky E722 errors in flake8. There are a lot more issues in generated code that flake8 pulls out.

Github user asfgit closed the pull request at:

https://github.com/apache/thrift/pull/1399
